medical_history.chief_complaint: Right lower abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began two days prior to presentation with nausea and multiple episodes of non-bloody, non-bilious emesis. Watery, non-bloody diarrhea occurred around this time. One day prior to presentation, sharp RLQ pain started, worsening with movement and not related to food. Patient has not had a bowel movement since the previous day and reports reduced flatus and anorexia. At presentation, the patient continues to feel RLQ pain but has not had nausea/vomiting for the last day.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hodgkin's Lymphoma, in remission s/p chemotherapy; Lymphoma biopsy; Port placement.
